meanings.definition: To force out of a home territory or particular place.
examples: Many families were displaced by the flood.

images.alt: Photo of people and canvas tents.
images.description: People, including adults and small children, in an area with many canvas tents. A wooden house is on a small hill near the group of tents.
images.caption: People displaced from their homes often need to live in temporary housing like these tents.

source.title: Emergency food, drinking water and shelter to help people displaced in Rakhine State, western Burma.
source.author: DFID - UK Department for International Development

meanings.definition: A system of rule or government.
examples: The current military regime has run the government for over twenty years.

meanings.definition: To make smaller or cause to appear smaller in size or importance.
examples: The pain diminished after he took aspirin.

images.alt: Photo of a staircase that gets smaller as it gets higher.
images.description: A staircase with its base in a pool of water. As the staircase goes up and away, it gets smaller and narrower. It looks like the staircase disappears into the distance at the top.
images.caption: The staircase diminishes as it moves up and away.

meanings.definition: Fixed, firm, or steady in position; not shaky or easily moved.
examples: We are lucky to have a stable form of government.

images.alt: Photo of a stack of logs.
images.description: Wood logs cut into pieces and stacked in long, low line.
images.caption: Firewood piled up into a sturdy, stable pile that will not fall.

meanings.definition: To make a careful guess about the amount, size, or worth of.
examples: We estimated that our grocery bill would be about $50.

meanings.definition: To come upon after losing something and searching for it.
examples: Stem cells are found in different parts of the human body, including in our blood.

images.alt: Photo of a father and daughter reading a book.
images.description: A father and daughter reading a book.
images.caption: This child is finding hidden objects in this popup book.

source.title: Dad and Daughter Reading a Cutouts Fairy Tale Book
source.author: cottonbro

meanings.definition: To come upon after losing something and searching for it.
examples: Stem cells are located in different parts of the human body, including in our blood.

images.alt: Photo of a father and daughter reading a book.
images.description: A father and daughter reading a book.
images.caption: This child is finding hidden objects in this popup book.

source.title: Dad and Daughter Reading a Cutouts Fairy Tale Book
source.author: cottonbro

meanings.definition: To state or demand as one's right.
examples: Members of the U.S. government claimed that the Iraqi regime had weapons of mass destruction that could be used against Americans.

meanings.definition: To say or claim to be true without having proof.
examples: Members of the U.S. government alleged that the Iraqi regime had weapons of mass destruction that could be used against Americans.
Members of the U.S. government claimed that the Iraqi regime had weapons of mass destruction that could be used against Americans.

meanings.definition: A cause of spending money or paying out.
examples: Buying a new car is a big expense.

images.alt: photo of person paying for something with a credit card
images.description: A person paying for something with a credit card
images.caption: When you buy things, you pay for them with cash, credit, or with a debit account.

meanings.definition: The act of paying or spending money.
examples: Buying a new car means that you will be making a big expenditure.

images.alt: photo of person paying for something with a credit card
images.description: A person paying for something with a credit card
images.caption: When you buy things, you pay for them with cash, credit, or with a debit account.

meanings.definition: The amount of money charged or paid for something.
examples: Buying a new car is a big cost.

images.alt: photo of person paying for something with a credit card
images.description: A person paying for something with a credit card
images.caption: When you buy things, you pay for them with cash, credit, or with a debit account.

meanings.definition: Having to do with what happens inside a country.
examples: Many Americans think that this money should have been used for domestic issues, like improving American schools.

meanings.definition: Having to do with what happens inside a country.
examples: Many Americans think that this money should have been used for internal issues, like improving American schools.

meanings.definition: Having to do with what happens inside a country.
examples: Many Americans think that this money should have been used for national issues, like improving American schools.
Should we commit troops when our economic interests are threatened?

meanings.definition: To choose for a particular job or purpose.
examples: Should we designate troops when our economic interests are threatened?
Should we send troops when our economic interests are threatened?
